trans-unit.source: SQL Server Data Warehousing and Transactional Workloads in Azure Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Data Warehousing and Transactional Workloads in Azure Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: Describes the preconfigured and optimized SQL Server virtual machine images in Azure for data warehousing and OLTP workloads.
trans-unit.target: Describes the preconfigured and optimized SQL Server virtual machine images in Azure for data warehousing and OLTP workloads.

trans-unit.source: To use SQL Server for data warehousing or transactional workloads in an Azure Virtual Machine, we recommend using one of the preconfigured virtual machine images in the Azure Virtual Machines Gallery.
trans-unit.target: To use SQL Server for data warehousing or transactional workloads in an Azure Virtual Machine, we recommend using one of the preconfigured virtual machine images in the Azure Virtual Machines Gallery.

trans-unit.source: These images have been optimized based on the recommendations in <linkText>Performance Best Practices for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: These images have been optimized based on the recommendations in <linkText>Performance Best Practices for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This article focuses on running these workloads on Azure Virtual Machines (this is also known as Infrastructure-as-a-Service or IaaS).
trans-unit.target: This article focuses on running these workloads on Azure Virtual Machines (this is also known as Infrastructure-as-a-Service or IaaS).

trans-unit.source: You can also run data warehousing and transactional workloads as a service in Azure.
trans-unit.target: You can also run data warehousing and transactional workloads as a service in Azure.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Azure SQL Data Warehouse Preview</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Azure SQL Data Warehouse Preview</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following preconfigured VM images are available in the Azure VM Gallery:
trans-unit.target: The following preconfigured VM images are available in the Azure VM Gallery:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SQL Server 2014 Enterprise Optimized for Transactional Workloads on Windows Server 2012 R2</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SQL Server 2014 Enterprise Optimized for Transactional Workloads on Windows Server 2012 R2</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SQL Server 2014 Enterprise Optimized for DataWarehousing on Windows Server 2012 R2</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SQL Server 2014 Enterprise Optimized for DataWarehousing on Windows Server 2012 R2</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for Transactional Workloads on Windows Server 2012 R2</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for Transactional Workloads on Windows Server 2012 R2</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for DataWarehousing Workloads on Windows Server 2012 R2</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for DataWarehousing Workloads on Windows Server 2012 R2</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for Transactional Workloads on Windows Server 2012</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for Transactional Workloads on Windows Server 2012</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for DataWarehousing on Windows Server 2012</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for DataWarehousing on Windows Server 2012</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Currently we support these images on VM instances that allow up to 16 data disks attached to provide the highest throughput (or aggregate bandwidth).
trans-unit.target: Currently we support these images on VM instances that allow up to 16 data disks attached to provide the highest throughput (or aggregate bandwidth).

trans-unit.source: These instances are Standard Tier A4, A7, A8, A9, D4, D13, D14, F3, G4, and G5 and Basic tier A4.
trans-unit.target: These instances are Standard Tier A4, A7, A8, A9, D4, D13, D14, F3, G4, and G5 and Basic tier A4.

trans-unit.source: Please refer to <linkText>Virtual Machine Sizes in Azure</linkText><title></title> for further details on the sizes and options.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to <linkText>Virtual Machine Sizes in Azure</linkText><title></title> for further details on the sizes and options.

trans-unit.source: Prior to September 2014, previous transactional and DW gallery images were available.
trans-unit.target: Prior to September 2014, previous transactional and DW gallery images were available.

trans-unit.source: However, those images required you to attach data disks to be usable.
trans-unit.target: However, those images required you to attach data disks to be usable.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to use the newer images above, because they are ready for use upon provisioning.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to use the newer images above, because they are ready for use upon provisioning.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click VIRTUAL MACHINE in the Azure menu items in the left pane.
trans-unit.target: Click VIRTUAL MACHINE in the Azure menu items in the left pane.

trans-unit.source: Click NEW in the bottom left corner, and then click COMPUTE, VIRTUAL MACHINE, and FROM GALLERY.
trans-unit.target: Click NEW in the bottom left corner, and then click COMPUTE, VIRTUAL MACHINE, and FROM GALLERY.

trans-unit.source: On the Virtual machine image selection page, select one of the SQL Server for transactional or Data Warehousing images.
trans-unit.target: On the Virtual machine image selection page, select one of the SQL Server for transactional or Data Warehousing images.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure VM Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure VM Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Virtual machine configuration page, in the SIZE option, choose from the supported sizes.
trans-unit.target: On the Virtual machine configuration page, in the SIZE option, choose from the supported sizes.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure VM Gallery Configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure VM Gallery Configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Only the Standard tier A4, A7, A8, A9, D4, D13, D14, G3, G4, and G5 and Basic Tier A4 are currently supported.
trans-unit.target: Only the Standard tier A4, A7, A8, A9, D4, D13, D14, G3, G4, and G5 and Basic Tier A4 are currently supported.

trans-unit.source: Attempts to provision unsupported VM sizes will fail.
trans-unit.target: Attempts to provision unsupported VM sizes will fail.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the provisioning to finish.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the provisioning to finish.

trans-unit.source: While waiting, you can see the provisioning status on the virtual machines page (as in the picture below).
trans-unit.target: While waiting, you can see the provisioning status on the virtual machines page (as in the picture below).

trans-unit.source: When the provisioning is finished, the status will be Running with a checkmark.
trans-unit.target: When the provisioning is finished, the status will be Running with a checkmark.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure VM Gallery Status</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure VM Gallery Status</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can also use the PowerShell Commandlet New-AzureQuickVM to create the VM.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the PowerShell Commandlet New-AzureQuickVM to create the VM.

trans-unit.source: You must pass your cloud service name, VM name, image name, Admin user name and password, and similar information as parameters.
trans-unit.target: You must pass your cloud service name, VM name, image name, Admin user name and password, and similar information as parameters.

trans-unit.source: A simple way is to obtain the image name is to use Get-AzureVMImage to list all the available VM images.
trans-unit.target: A simple way is to obtain the image name is to use Get-AzureVMImage to list all the available VM images.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following PowerShell command returns the latest image that matches the image label SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for DataWarehousing Workloads on Windows Server 2012 R2 from the list in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: For example, the following PowerShell command returns the latest image that matches the image label SQL Server 2012 SP2 Enterprise Optimized for DataWarehousing Workloads on Windows Server 2012 R2 from the list in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: For more information about creating images with PowerShell, see <linkText>Use Azure PowerShell to create and preconfigure Windows-based Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about creating images with PowerShell, see <linkText>Use Azure PowerShell to create and preconfigure Windows-based Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The optimizations included in the images are based on the <linkText>Performance Best Practices for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The optimizations included in the images are based on the <linkText>Performance Best Practices for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Specifically, the configuration for these images include the following optimizations.
trans-unit.target: Specifically, the configuration for these images include the following optimizations.

trans-unit.source: If you are bringing your own license and creating a Data Warehousing or Transactional virtual machine from scratch, you can base your optimizations on the performance article and the example of the optimizations in the preconfigured gallery images below.
trans-unit.target: If you are bringing your own license and creating a Data Warehousing or Transactional virtual machine from scratch, you can base your optimizations on the performance article and the example of the optimizations in the preconfigured gallery images below.

trans-unit.source: Configuration
trans-unit.target: Configuration

trans-unit.source: Setting
trans-unit.target: Setting

trans-unit.source: Number of data disks attached
trans-unit.target: Number of data disks attached

trans-unit.source: Storage spaces
trans-unit.target: Storage spaces

trans-unit.source:
Two storage pools:
--1 data pool with 12 data disks; fixed size 12 TB; Column = 12
--1 log pool with 3 data disks; fixed size 3 TB; Column = 3

One data disk remaining for the user to attach and determine the usage.

DW: Stripe size = 256 KB
Transactional: Stripe size = 64 KB
trans-unit.target:
Two storage pools:
--1 data pool with 12 data disks; fixed size 12 TB; Column = 12
--1 log pool with 3 data disks; fixed size 3 TB; Column = 3

One data disk remaining for the user to attach and determine the usage.

DW: Stripe size = 256 KB
Transactional: Stripe size = 64 KB

trans-unit.source: Disk sizes
trans-unit.target: Disk sizes

trans-unit.source: 1 TB each
trans-unit.target: 1 TB each

trans-unit.source: Caching
trans-unit.target: Caching

trans-unit.source: HostCache=None
trans-unit.target: HostCache=None

trans-unit.source: Allocation size
trans-unit.target: Allocation size

trans-unit.source: NTFS Allocation Unit Size = 64KB
trans-unit.target: NTFS Allocation Unit Size = 64KB

trans-unit.source: Configuration
trans-unit.target: Configuration

trans-unit.source: Setting
trans-unit.target: Setting

trans-unit.source: Startup Parameters
trans-unit.target: Startup Parameters

trans-unit.source:
-T1117 to help keep data files the same size in case the database needs to autogrow

-T1118 to assist in tempdb scalability (For more information, see [SQL Server (2005 and 2008) Trace Flag 1118 (-T1118) Usage](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/psssql/archive/2008/12/17/sql-server-2005-and-2008-trace-flag-1118-t1118-usage.aspx?WT.mcid=BlogSQLAnnounceAnnounce).)
trans-unit.target:
-T1117 to help keep data files the same size in case the database needs to autogrow

-T1118 to assist in tempdb scalability (For more information, see [SQL Server (2005 and 2008) Trace Flag 1118 (-T1118) Usage](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/psssql/archive/2008/12/17/sql-server-2005-and-2008-trace-flag-1118-t1118-usage.aspx?WT.mcid=BlogSQLAnnounceAnnounce).)

trans-unit.source: Recovery model
trans-unit.target: Recovery model

trans-unit.source:
DW: Set to SIMPLE for model database using ALTER DATABASE
Transactional: No change
trans-unit.target:
DW: Set to SIMPLE for model database using ALTER DATABASE
Transactional: No change

trans-unit.source: Setup default locations
trans-unit.target: Setup default locations

trans-unit.source: Move the SQL Server error log and trace file directories to data disks
trans-unit.target: Move the SQL Server error log and trace file directories to data disks

trans-unit.source: Default locations for databases
trans-unit.target: Default locations for databases

trans-unit.source:
System databases moved to data disks.

The location for creating user databases changed to data disks.
trans-unit.target:
System databases moved to data disks.

The location for creating user databases changed to data disks.

trans-unit.source: Instant File Initialization
trans-unit.target: Instant File Initialization

trans-unit.source: Enabled
trans-unit.target: Enabled

trans-unit.source: Lock pages in memory
trans-unit.target: Lock pages in memory

trans-unit.source: Enabled (For more information, see <linkText>Enable the Lock Pages in Memory Option (Windows)</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Enabled (For more information, see <linkText>Enable the Lock Pages in Memory Option (Windows)</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Is there any price difference between the optimized images and the non-optimized ones?
trans-unit.target: Is there any price difference between the optimized images and the non-optimized ones?

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: The optimized images follow the same pricing model (details <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>) with no additional cost.
trans-unit.target: The optimized images follow the same pricing model (details <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>) with no additional cost.

trans-unit.source: Note that a higher cost is associated with the larger VM instance sizes.
trans-unit.target: Note that a higher cost is associated with the larger VM instance sizes.

trans-unit.source: Any other performance fixes I should consider?
trans-unit.target: Any other performance fixes I should consider?

trans-unit.source: Yes, consider applying relevant performance fixes for SQL Server:
trans-unit.target: Yes, consider applying relevant performance fixes for SQL Server:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>FIX: Poor performance on I/O when you execute select into temporary table operation in SQL Server 2012</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>FIX: Poor performance on I/O when you execute select into temporary table operation in SQL Server 2012</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>FIX: "SQL Server performance counters are disabled" when you move the SQL Server resource in SQL Server 2014</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>FIX: "SQL Server performance counters are disabled" when you move the SQL Server resource in SQL Server 2014</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: How can I find more information on Storage Spaces?
trans-unit.target: How can I find more information on Storage Spaces?

trans-unit.source: For further details on Storage Spaces, please refer to <linkText>Storage Spaces Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For further details on Storage Spaces, please refer to <linkText>Storage Spaces Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: What is the difference between the new DW image and the previous one?
trans-unit.target: What is the difference between the new DW image and the previous one?

trans-unit.source: The previous DW image requires customers to perform additional steps such as attaching the data disks after creating the VM while the new DW image is ready for use upon creation so it is available more quickly and has less chance of errors.
trans-unit.target: The previous DW image requires customers to perform additional steps such as attaching the data disks after creating the VM while the new DW image is ready for use upon creation so it is available more quickly and has less chance of errors.

trans-unit.source: What if I need to use the previous DW image?
trans-unit.target: What if I need to use the previous DW image?

trans-unit.source: Is there any way I can access it?
trans-unit.target: Is there any way I can access it?

trans-unit.source: The previous VM images are still available, just not directly accessible from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: The previous VM images are still available, just not directly accessible from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: Instead, you can continue using Powershell commandlets.
trans-unit.target: Instead, you can continue using Powershell commandlets.

trans-unit.source: For instance, you can use Get-AzureVMImage to list out all the images and when you locate the previous DW image based on the description and publish date, you can use New-AzureVM to provision.
trans-unit.target: For instance, you can use Get-AzureVMImage to list out all the images and when you locate the previous DW image based on the description and publish date, you can use New-AzureVM to provision.

trans-unit.source: After installing any virtual machine with SQL Server, you will likely want to:
trans-unit.target: After installing any virtual machine with SQL Server, you will likely want to:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Migrate your data</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Migrate your data</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Setup connectivity</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Setup connectivity</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: For other topics related to running SQL Server in Azure VMs, see <linkText>SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For other topics related to running SQL Server in Azure VMs, see <linkText>SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>.
